subtasks.hazard: Vehicle Collision or Rollover during Marshalling

values: Enforce speed limits of 5 km/h in the marshalling yard.
Use ground guides at all vehicle turn‑around and parking points.
Maintain a minimum 2 m lateral separation between vehicles.
All crew members must wear seatbelts and G‑forces restraint harnesses.
Conduct a pre‑movement safety brief covering hazard zones.
Ramp brief conducted by the CO/1SG before any vehicle movement.
Ground guides positioned by the convoy commander.
CO, 1SG, Vehicle Crews, Ground Guides
Validate load plans against the MARSHALLING CHECKLIST.
All tie‑downs must be inspected and signed by the vehicle commander.
Dual‑point securement required for all cargo and ammunition.
Conduct a visual inspection of hatches, doors, and ramps after tie‑down.
PCC/PCI performed by Inspectors; deficiencies corrected before re‑inspection.
Designated Inspectors, Vehicle Commanders, PLs
All crew members must wear NVG‑compatible eye protection.
Conduct a night‑move rehearsal with NVGs at least 2 hours before SP.
Mark all hazards with reflective tape and white lights.
Use white light/infrared strobes on vehicle exteriors for identification.
Night‑vision safety brief issued by the RSO.
Ground guides equipped with IR strobes.
RSO, Ground Guides, Vehicle Crews
Verify all radios are on the correct frequency 30 minutes prior to SP.
Test ATAK, WICKR, and Signal chat handles during the PCC.
Designate a Primary and Alternate communication node for each serial.
Establish a PACE plan for loss of voice communications.
Radio check‑list completed by each VC.
Signal group chat confirmed by OIC.
VCs, Signal NCO, OIC
All fire extinguishers inspected and mounted per HAZMAT SOP.
HAZMAT placards displayed on vehicles carrying regulated loads.
IAA (Improperly Armed Ammunition) check performed during inspection.
Designate a fire‑fighting detail equipped with 2 lb Class III extinguishers.
Fire‑fighting detail briefed during the safety conference.
HHA, RSO, Fire Detail
All dispatch books must contain Form 91, DD‑518, DA‑5987, and driver licenses before SP.
Marshalling checklist signed by CO/1SG and archived digitally.
Electronic copies of route books, AT‑AK, and WICKR handles uploaded to the unit drive.
Final paperwork review conducted by the NCOIC.
PCC includes verification of all required forms.
NCOIC, Clerical Staff, Vehicle Commanders
100 % PAX accountability confirmed via ICE check before SP.
All personnel wear high‑visibility vests with name tags.
Headcount conducted at each checkpoint and after any security halt.
Serial OIC responsible for PAX roll call before movement.
Serial OIC, Squad Leaders, RSO
Check METAR/forecast the night before and monitor during SP.
If precipitation or reduced visibility exceeds limits, suspend marshalling.
Brief crews on wildlife avoidance and reporting procedures.
Weather brief by S2 incorporated into the safety conference.
S2, OIC, RSO

overall_supervision_plan: The OIC, RSO, and the HHT Inspection NCO will conduct a comprehensive safety brief prior to any vehicle movement.  All control measures listed in each subtask will be verified during the PCC/PCI process and enforced by ground guides and convoy leaders.  Continuous supervision will be provided by the CO/1SG during the inspection window and by the RSO during night‑time operations.  With these mitigations the overall residual risk is assessed as low.
mission_task_and_description: Hammer Troop vehicle marshalling and inspection on 30 May 2025 to prepare crews for future TRMs.
